presentation.title: As a junior developer, have you ever found it difficult to...
presentation.question1: Feel legitimate in the tech world ?
presentation.question4: Get motivated to keep developing your skills ?

why.bigText: Letâ€™s smash the impostor syndrome together!
why.bullet1: For the junior developers with no engineering degree, who donâ€™t take computers to pieces every weekend and didnâ€™t start coding when they were 5
why.bullet2: Made with love by feminist, queer, inclusive devs and other fucking friendly people

header.bigText: At Electronic Tales we want to make computer culture human readable.
header.middleText: i.e. within the reach of everyone.
header.littleText: To do so, we sat, <strike>ate toasts with slightly salted butter,</strike> we thought, we sketched out main lines (and hatched concepts).

id1.text: Building a safe space for peer support between junior devs

id2.text: Helping junior devs to strengthen their software and hardware skills

id3.text: Analysing and deciphering the geek culture codes

id4.text: Motivating junior devs to keep learning alongside their job

id1.text: Evening classes and workshops, online and in real

id2.text: Social wall/Discord/other way to communicate anonymously between juniors (you name it)

id3.text: Micro-learning, storytelling, sandbox â€“ to learn everywhere without ZzzZ

id4.text: Cool contents in you mail box, your Insta or your Facebook (but the later is apparently old-fashioned)

header.middleText: To bring those ideas to life, our team is whipping up a social learning platform.
header.littleText: It will be the base of the Electronic Tales project and will be built on three learning tracks.

form.waitAMinute: Wait a sec... What will happen to me if I give you my email ?

id1.desc: You become a member of the Electronic Tales co-creatorsâ€™ pool... of the Team ! It means that you can, if you wish so, add Electronic Tales as work experience on &Co.

id2.desc:
Fear not !

Actually, we are not going to ask you to write a series of astoundingly deep articles about z-index in CSS or to code a dark-theme for irs.gov.

You will see, it is very simple !

id3.desc: On a regular basis, but not too often, we will write you to ask you some questions of the utmost importance (e.g. which one of these designs do you prefer, which topics would interest you, etc.). Answering it will never take you more than five minutes. And if you feel a lack of inspiration, you can write us to tell us our questions are stupid (or you can just not answer at all).

id4.desc: We will owe you eternal gratitude.
id4.question: So, ready to go?
id4.callToAction: If yes, go back to step #1 and drop us your e-mail !
